exam.title: YDS Tam Deneme Sınavı 4
exam.description: 80 soruluk tam boy YDS deneme sınavı - Gerçek sınav formatında hazırlanmıştır

questions.question_text: The researchers ---- the experiment three times before they ---- any conclusive results.
questions.explanation: Geçmişte tamamlanmış iki eylemden önce gerçekleşeni 'past perfect' (had conducted), sonra gerçekleşeni 'simple past' (obtained) ile ifade ederiz. Araştırmacılar önce deneyi üç kez yapmış, sonra kesin sonuçlar elde etmiş.

questions.question_text: The government's new environmental policy aims to ---- carbon emissions by 40% over the next decade.
questions.explanation: 'Reduce' (azaltmak) karbon emisyonları bağlamında doğru kelimedir. 'Enhance' (artırmak/geliştirmek), 'multiply' (çoğaltmak), 'sustain' (sürdürmek) ve 'promote' (teşvik etmek) bu bağlamda anlamsızdır.

questions.question_text: ---- the severe weather conditions, the construction team managed to complete the project on schedule.
questions.explanation: 'Despite' ardından isim veya isim grubu gelir (despite + noun). 'Although' ve 'even though' ardından cümle gelir. 'In spite' eksik (in spite of olmalı). 'However' cümle başında kullanılırsa virgül gerektirir.

questions.question_text: The economic crisis had a ---- effect on small businesses, with many forced to close permanently.
questions.explanation: 'Devastating' (yıkıcı) cümlenin ikinci kısmındaki 'forced to close permanently' ile uyumludur. Diğer seçenekler olumlu ya da önemsiz etki belirtir.

questions.question_text: The committee recommended that the proposal ---- before the end of the month.
questions.explanation: 'Recommend', 'suggest', 'propose' gibi fiillerden sonra 'that' clause'da subjunctive mood kullanılır: (that) + subject + base form. Bu nedenle 'be submitted' doğrudur.

questions.question_text: Scientists have yet to ---- a comprehensive explanation for the phenomenon observed in the recent study.
questions.explanation: 'Formulate' (formüle etmek, geliştirmek) açıklama ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur. 'Have yet to' (henüz yapamamak) ifadesiyle birlikte kullanılır.

questions.question_text: ---- in the 1960s, the building still retains much of its original architectural character.
questions.explanation: Passive participle (past participle) kullanılır çünkü bina inşa edilmiştir (passive). 'Constructed in the 1960s' = 'Which was constructed in the 1960s'.

questions.question_text: The research team's findings ---- the previous assumptions about climate change patterns in the region.
questions.explanation: 'Challenged' (sorgulamak, meydan okumak) bilimsel araştırma bağlamında yaygın kullanılır ve önceki varsayımları test etme anlamı taşır.

questions.question_text: The more sophisticated the technology becomes, ---- it is to operate without specialized training.
questions.explanation: 'The + comparative..., the + comparative...' yapısı kullanılır. 'The more sophisticated..., the more difficult...' = Teknoloji ne kadar karmaşıklaşırsa, kullanımı o kadar zorlaşır.

questions.question_text: The company decided to ---- its operations to Asian markets in order to increase revenue.
questions.explanation: 'Expand' (genişletmek) operations ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur ve 'increase revenue' (geliri artırmak) amacıyla tutarlıdır.

questions.question_text: Had the authorities taken immediate action, the damage ---- much less severe.
questions.explanation: Inverted third conditional: 'Had + subject + past participle' = 'If + subject + had + past participle'. Ana cümlede 'would have been' kullanılır. Geçmiş gerçekleşmeyen durum ve sonuç ifade eder.

questions.question_text: The pharmaceutical company is seeking regulatory ---- for its new drug before it can enter the market.
questions.explanation: 'Approval' (onay) regulatory ile kollokasyon oluşturur. İlaçların pazara çıkabilmesi için düzenleyici onay alması gerekir.

questions.question_text: By the time the emergency services arrived, the fire ---- to the neighboring buildings.
questions.explanation: 'By the time' + past simple, past perfect kullanılır. Acil servisler gelmeden önce yangın yayılmıştı (önce gerçekleşen eylem = past perfect).

questions.question_text: The study's methodology was ---- criticized by several experts in the field for its lack of statistical rigor.
questions.explanation: 'Severely criticized' (şiddetle eleştirilmek) akademik bağlamda güçlü eleştiri ifadesidir. 'Lack of statistical rigor' ciddi bir eksikliktir.

questions.question_text: The professor suggested ---- the research methodology before submitting the proposal to the committee.
questions.explanation: 'Suggest' fiilinden sonra gerund (-ing) veya 'that + subjunctive' kullanılır. Bu seçenekler arasında sadece 'revising' (gerund) doğrudur.

questions.question_text: The economic indicators ---- that the country is heading toward a period of sustained growth.
questions.explanation: 'Indicate' (göstermek, işaret etmek) ekonomik göstergeler ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur. Indicators (göstergeler) + indicate (gösterir) kullanımı yaygındır.

questions.question_text: Not only ---- the experiment fail to produce the expected results, but it also raised serious safety concerns.
questions.explanation: 'Not only' cümle başında olduğunda inversion (devrik cümle) yapılır: Not only + auxiliary + subject + main verb. Geçmiş zaman bağlamında 'did' kullanılır.

questions.question_text: The archaeological findings ---- valuable insights into ancient civilizations in the region.
questions.explanation: 'Provide insights' (içgörü sağlamak) sabit bir akademik kollokasyondur. Arkeolojik bulgular antik uygarlıklar hakkında değerli içgörüler sağlar.

questions.question_text: It is essential that every participant ---- the confidentiality agreement before joining the study.
questions.explanation: 'It is essential/important/necessary that' yapısından sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: subject + base form (sign). Formal akademik İngilizce'de yaygındır.

questions.question_text: The research demonstrated a strong ---- between childhood nutrition and academic performance in later years.
questions.explanation: 'Correlation' (korelasyon, ilişki) bilimsel araştırmalarda iki değişken arasındaki ilişkiyi ifade eden teknik terimdir. 'Strong correlation' yaygın bir akademik ifadedir.

questions.question_text: While renewable energy sources offer significant environmental benefits, ----.
questions.option_a: their initial installation costs can be prohibitively high for developing nations
questions.option_b: fossil fuels are becoming increasingly scarce in many regions
questions.option_c: solar panels have become more efficient over the past decade
questions.option_d: wind power is the most rapidly growing energy sector globally
questions.option_e: hydroelectric dams provide clean and reliable electricity
questions.explanation: 'While' bir kontrast (karşıtlık) ifade eder. İlk cümlede yenilenebilir enerjinin faydalarından bahsediliyor, dolayısıyla ikinci kısımda bir dezavantaj veya zorluk olmalı. A seçeneği yüksek maliyetlerden bahsederek kontrast sağlar.

questions.question_text: The ancient Greek philosophers made significant contributions to Western thought, ----.
questions.option_a: although Rome eventually conquered Greece militarily
questions.option_b: many of which continue to influence contemporary philosophy and science
questions.option_c: because they lived in democratic city-states
questions.option_d: while Egypt had already developed advanced mathematics
questions.option_e: after the Bronze Age collapse disrupted Mediterranean civilizations
questions.explanation: Cümle Yunan filozoflarının katkılarından bahsediyor. B seçeneği bu katkıların günümüze kadar etkisini vurgulayarak cümleyi mantıksal olarak tamamlar. 'Many of which' relative pronoun ile doğal bağlantı kurar.

questions.question_text: ---- before the development of modern antibiotics, infectious diseases were the leading cause of mortality worldwide.
questions.option_a: Since medical technology has advanced significantly
questions.option_b: Although vaccines have proven highly effective
questions.explanation: Cümle modern antibiyotiklerin geliştirilmesinden önce enfeksiyonların ölüm nedeni olduğunu söylüyor. C seçeneği ('20. yüzyılın ortalarına kadar') bu zaman çerçevesini net olarak belirtir.

questions.question_text: The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence technology has raised important ethical questions, ----.
questions.option_a: such as how to ensure AI systems respect human rights and privacy
questions.option_b: because computers have become faster and more powerful
questions.option_c: although machine learning algorithms are complex
questions.option_d: until neural networks were invented in the 1980s
questions.option_e: while software engineers receive competitive salaries
questions.explanation: Cümle yapay zekanın etik sorular doğurduğunu belirtiyor. A seçeneği 'such as' ile somut örnekler vererek bu etik soruları açıklıyor (insan hakları ve gizlilik).

questions.question_text: Although the initial results appeared promising, ----.
questions.option_a: the research team secured additional funding for the project
questions.option_b: subsequent trials failed to replicate the findings
questions.option_c: the methodology was praised by independent reviewers
questions.option_e: peer review accelerated the publication process
questions.explanation: 'Although' kontrast belirtir. İlk sonuçlar umut vericiyken, ikinci kısımda olumsuz bir gelişme olmalı. B seçeneği sonraki denemelerin başarısız olduğunu belirterek kontrast sağlar.

questions.question_text: ---- the company's revenue declined for three consecutive quarters, investors began to lose confidence.
questions.explanation: 'As soon as' (... -ir -maz, ... -dığında hemen) neden-sonuç ilişkisini ifade eder. Gelir düştüğünde, yatırımcılar güvenini kaybetti - mantıksal bağlantı doğru.

questions.question_text: Marine biologists have discovered that coral reefs, ----, are among the most biodiverse ecosystems on Earth.
questions.option_a: which cover less than 1% of the ocean floor
questions.option_b: although they are threatened by climate change
questions.option_c: because they provide habitat for fish
questions.explanation: Virgüller arasındaki kısım ek bilgi (non-defining relative clause) verir. A seçeneği 'which' ile başlayarak mercan resiflerinin okyanusun küçük bir kısmını kapladığı bilgisini ekler, bu da sonraki 'en çeşitli ekosistem' vurgusunu güçlendirir.

questions.question_text: The government implemented new regulations ---- reducing air pollution in urban areas.
questions.explanation: 'Aimed at' (amaçlayan, hedefleyen) düzenlemeler ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur ve amaç ifade eder. Hükümet hava kirliliğini azaltmayı amaçlayan düzenlemeler uyguladı.

questions.question_text: ---- their extensive training and experience, the medical team was unable to save the patient's life.
questions.explanation: 'Despite' (rağmen) kontrast ifade eder. Geniş eğitim ve deneyimlerine rağmen ekip hastayı kurtaramadı - mantıksal karşıtlık var. 'Because of', 'due to', 'owing to' neden belirtir, 'thanks to' pozitif sonuç gerektirir.

questions.question_text: The archaeological evidence suggests that ----, contrary to previous assumptions about the timeline of human migration.
questions.option_a: modern humans reached the Americas much earlier than thought
questions.option_b: agriculture was developed independently in multiple regions
questions.option_c: stone tools were the primary technology for millennia
questions.explanation: 'Contrary to previous assumptions' (önceki varsayımların aksine) ifadesi bir değişiklik, düzeltme gerektirir. A seçeneği insanların Amerika'ya önceden düşünülenden çok daha erken ulaştığını belirterek bu karşıtlığı sağlar.

(IV) This property allows quantum computers to solve certain problems exponentially faster than classical computers. questions.option_b: Classical computers have become increasingly powerful over the decades

questions.passage:
The concept of emotional intelligence (EI) has gained considerable attention in psychology and organizational behavior research since Daniel Goleman popularized it in the 1990s. Emotional intelligence refers to the ability to recognize, understand, and manage one's own emotions, as well as to recognize, understand, and influence the emotions of others. Unlike traditional measures of intelligence that focus primarily on cognitive abilities, emotional intelligence encompasses a broader range of skills that are crucial for interpersonal effectiveness and personal well-being.

The framework most commonly used to understand emotional intelligence consists of four key components. First, self-awareness involves recognizing one's own emotions and their effects. Individuals with high self-awareness can accurately identify their emotional states and understand how these emotions influence their thoughts and behaviors. Second, self-management refers to the ability to control or redirect disruptive emotions and adapt to changing circumstances. This includes skills such as emotional self-control, maintaining standards of honesty and integrity, and remaining optimistic despite setbacks. Third, social awareness encompasses the ability to understand the emotional makeup of other people and to treat them according to their emotional reactions. This includes empathy, organizational awareness, and service orientation. Finally, relationship management involves the ability to inspire, influence, and develop others while managing conflict effectively.

Research has demonstrated that emotional intelligence correlates with numerous positive outcomes in both personal and professional domains. In the workplace, employees with higher EI tend to perform better, particularly in roles requiring extensive interpersonal interaction. They are more likely to emerge as leaders, build stronger professional relationships, and handle workplace stress more effectively. Studies have also found that emotional intelligence contributes to better mental health, higher life satisfaction, and more successful romantic relationships. However, critics argue that the concept of emotional intelligence lacks precise definition and that existing measures of EI have questionable validity. Some researchers contend that what is measured as emotional intelligence may simply reflect personality traits such as agreeableness and conscientiousness, or may overlap substantially with traditional cognitive intelligence. Despite these controversies, emotional intelligence remains an influential concept in contemporary psychology and organizational development.

questions.option_d: Emotional intelligence is easier to measure objectively than traditional intelligence
questions.option_e: Emotional intelligence develops earlier in life than traditional intelligence

The concept of emotional intelligence (EI) has gained considerable attention in psychology and organizational behavior research since Daniel Goleman popularized it in the 1990s. Emotional intelligence refers to the ability to recognize, understand, and manage one's own emotions, as well as to recognize, understand, and influence the emotions of others. Unlike traditional measures of intelligence that focus primarily on cognitive abilities, emotional intelligence encompasses a broader range of skills that are crucial for interpersonal effectiveness and personal well-being.

The framework most commonly used to understand emotional intelligence consists of four key components. First, self-awareness involves recognizing one's own emotions and their effects. Individuals with high self-awareness can accurately identify their emotional states and understand how these emotions influence their thoughts and behaviors. Second, self-management refers to the ability to control or redirect disruptive emotions and adapt to changing circumstances. This includes skills such as emotional self-control, maintaining standards of honesty and integrity, and remaining optimistic despite setbacks. Third, social awareness encompasses the ability to understand the emotional makeup of other people and to treat them according to their emotional reactions. This includes empathy, organizational awareness, and service orientation. Finally, relationship management involves the ability to inspire, influence, and develop others while managing conflict effectively.

Research has demonstrated that emotional intelligence correlates with numerous positive outcomes in both personal and professional domains. In the workplace, employees with higher EI tend to perform better, particularly in roles requiring extensive interpersonal interaction. They are more likely to emerge as leaders, build stronger professional relationships, and handle workplace stress more effectively. Studies have also found that emotional intelligence contributes to better mental health, higher life satisfaction, and more successful romantic relationships. However, critics argue that the concept of emotional intelligence lacks precise definition and that existing measures of EI have questionable validity. Some researchers contend that what is measured as emotional intelligence may simply reflect personality traits such as agreeableness and conscientiousness, or may overlap substantially with traditional cognitive intelligence. Despite these controversies, emotional intelligence remains an influential concept in contemporary psychology and organizational development.

Circadian rhythms are physical, mental, and behavioral changes that follow a 24-hour cycle, responding primarily to light and darkness in an organism's environment. These biological processes are found in most living things, including animals, plants, and microorganisms. In humans, circadian rhythms influence sleep-wake cycles, hormone release, body temperature, and other important bodily functions. The study of circadian rhythms is called chronobiology.

The master clock that regulates these rhythms is located in the suprachiasmatic nucleus (SCN), a tiny region of the brain in the hypothalamus. The SCN contains approximately 20,000 nerve cells and receives direct input from the eyes about the presence or absence of light. When light enters the eye, specialized photoreceptor cells in the retina send signals to the SCN, which then coordinates circadian rhythms throughout the body by sending signals to other brain regions and peripheral organs. This system evolved to help organisms anticipate and prepare for regular environmental changes associated with the day-night cycle.

Disruption of circadian rhythms has significant health consequences. Shift workers, who regularly work at night and sleep during the day, often experience circadian misalignment. Research has linked such disruptions to increased risk of cardiovascular disease, metabolic disorders including diabetes, mood disorders, and certain types of cancer. Even less severe disruptions, such as those caused by jet lag or daylight saving time changes, can temporarily impair cognitive function and mood. Modern lifestyles, characterized by artificial lighting, late-night screen use, and irregular sleep schedules, increasingly challenge our circadian systems. Understanding and respecting circadian rhythms—by maintaining consistent sleep schedules, getting bright light exposure during the day, and minimizing light exposure at night—can significantly improve health and well-being.

The concept of sustainable development emerged in the 1980s as a response to growing concerns about environmental degradation and resource depletion. The most widely cited definition comes from the 1987 Brundtland Report: 'development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.' This seemingly simple definition encompasses complex challenges spanning environmental protection, economic development, and social equity.

Achieving sustainable development requires balancing three interconnected pillars: environmental sustainability, economic viability, and social equity. Environmental sustainability involves protecting natural resources and ecosystems for future use. This includes reducing pollution, conserving biodiversity, and transitioning to renewable energy sources. Economic viability requires that development be economically feasible and not accumulate unsustainable debt. Sustainable economic practices include investing in green technologies, promoting circular economies where waste is minimized, and ensuring long-term profitability without depleting natural capital. Social equity demands that development benefits be distributed fairly across society, both within and between generations. questions.passage:
Epigenetics is a rapidly growing field that studies how behaviors and environment can cause changes that affect the way genes work. Unlike genetic mutations that alter the DNA sequence itself, epigenetic changes do not change the underlying DNA sequence but instead affect how cells 'read' genes. These modifications can be influenced by various factors including age, diet, stress, and exposure to toxins. What makes epigenetics particularly fascinating is that some of these changes can be passed down through generations, potentially allowing parents' experiences to influence their children's biology.

The primary mechanisms of epigenetic regulation include DNA methylation and histone modification. DNA methylation involves the addition of chemical tags called methyl groups to DNA, which typically silences gene expression. Histone modifications involve changes to the proteins around which DNA is wrapped, affecting how tightly or loosely the DNA is packaged and thus how accessible it is for activation. These modifications create an epigenetic 'landscape' that determines which genes are active in different cell types, explaining how cells with identical DNA can have vastly different functions—a neuron and a liver cell, for instance, contain the same genetic information but express different sets of genes.

The implications of epigenetic research are profound and far-reaching. In medicine, understanding epigenetic mechanisms has opened new approaches to treating diseases. Since epigenetic changes are potentially reversible, they represent promising therapeutic targets. Drugs that modify DNA methylation or histone acetylation are already being used to treat certain cancers. Beyond medical applications, epigenetics has forced scientists to reconsider the nature-versus-nurture debate. The field suggests that genes and environment are not separate influences but rather interact in complex ways throughout life. Some researchers have even proposed that epigenetic inheritance—the transmission of environmentally induced changes across generations—may represent a form of evolution operating on a much faster timescale than traditional genetic evolution. However, this remains controversial, and scientists continue to investigate the extent and mechanisms of transgenerational epigenetic inheritance.
